Pre-Game Insights: Sanjay Bangar suggested that the team management shouldn't be looking to rush Shubman Gill back into the lineup as it's a long tournament.
Bangar said that even if Gill is half fit, he himself would want to go out and play against Australia, but it's better to preserve him for the rest of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shubman Gill has been down with dengue and could miss the match against Australia.
Gill's participation in the opening World Cup match against Australia on October 8th, 2023, at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai is uncertain due to health issues.
Others: Gill amassed 1,230 runs from 20 matches at an average of 72.35 in ODIs this year.
If Gill remains unavailable for the clash on Sunday, Ishan Kishan could potentially replace him.
